units.title: Sample collection and consent
units.text: Human material and informed consent. The organoid lines used in this study were derived from biopsies (provided by Departments of Surgery and Pathology of the Diakonessenhuis hospital, Utrecht, The Netherlands) of a CRC and adjacent healthy colon mucosal epithelium taken from colon tissue resected during a left hemicolectomy to remove a CRC from a female patient (71 years of age). Tissue collection was approved by the medical ethical committee (METC) of the Diakonessenhuis hospital, in agreement with the declaration of Helsinki and according to Dutch and European Union legislation. The samples were collected under METC protocol 12/093 HUB-Cancer following written informed consent at the Diakonessenhuis hospital Utrecht.
units.rationale: Specifies ethical approval and source of patient material.

units.title: Isolation of colonic crypts
units.text: crypts of the healthy portion of the colonic epithelium (at least 10 cm away from the tumor side) were isolated by digestion of the intestinal mucosa in chelation solution (5.6 mM Na2HPO4, 8.0 mM KH2PO4, 96.2 mM NaCl, 1.6 mM KCl, 43.4 mM Sucrose, and 54.9 mM D-Sorbitol, Sigma) supplemented with dithiotreitol (0.5 mM, Sigma) and EDTA (2 mM, in-house) for 30 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Describes the enzymatic digestion used to obtain crypts.

units.title: Plating crypts in basement membrane extract
units.text: Colonic crypts were subsequently plated in basement membrane extract (BME; Cultrex PC BME RGF type 2, Amsbio). Organoids were grown in human intestinal stem cell medium (HISCM), which is composed of Advanced Dulbecco’s modified Eagle medium/F12 supplemented with penicillin/streptomycin, 10 mM HEPES and Glutamax (all Gibco, Thermo Fisher Scientific) with 50% Wnt3a conditioned medium (in-house), 20% R-Spondin1 conditioned medium (in-house), 10% Noggin conditioned medium (in-house), 1x B27, 1.25mM N-acetylcysteine, 10 mM nicotinamide, 50 ng/ml human EGF, 10 nM Gastrin, 500 nM A83-01, 10 nM prostaglandin E2 and 100 µg/ml Primocin (Invivogen).
units.rationale: Provides the matrix and culture medium composition for organoid growth.

units.title: Digestion of tumor biopsies into single cells
units.text: Tumor biopsies were digested into single cells using collagenase II (1 mg/ml, Gibco, Thermo Fisher Scientific), supplemented with hyaluronidase (10 µg/ml) and LY27632 (10 µM) for 30 min at 37 °C while shaking.
units.rationale: Details enzymatic dissociation of tumor tissue.

units.title: Plating dissociated tumor cells
units.text: Dissociated tumor cells were plated in BME and organoids were cultured in HICS minus Wnt conditioned medium supplemented with 10 µM LY27632 at 37 °C.
units.rationale: Describes initial culture conditions for tumor-derived cells.

units.title: Generation of clonal tumor organoid lines by FACS
units.text: To generate clonal tumor organoid lines, early passage tumor organoids were dissociated into single cells by TryPLE (Thermo Fisher Scientific), washed and suspended in FACS buffer (PBS with 2 mM EDTA and 5% FCS). Prior to FACS purification, DAPI was added to the FACS buffer. HLA-A2+ single cells were sorted into separate wells of 96-well plates containing 100 µl HISCM with 10 µM LY27632 and coated with BME.
units.rationale: Outlines single‑cell sorting to obtain clonal organoids.

units.title: Post‑sorting culture of clonal organoids
units.text: Sorted cells were then covered with 10 µl BME and placed in the incubator at 37 °C. LY27632 was added to the HISCM for the first week after sorting. Clonal tumor organoids were then expanded in HICS minus WNT conditioned medium.
units.rationale: Specifies the early culture steps after cell sorting.

units.title: DNA extraction and library preparation
units.text: Organoids were dissociated and DNA was isolated using the QiaSymphony DSP DNA Mini Kit (Qiagen; 937236). Libraries were prepared using the TruSeq DNA Nano Library Prep Kit (20015964). Paired-end sequencing of the generated libraries with 2 × 150 bp on the Illumina HiSeq X Ten sequencing system at 30× coverage.
units.rationale: Covers genomic DNA isolation and sequencing library construction.

units.title: Organoid harvest and cell recovery
units.text: On the day of harvest, organoids were removed from the 6-well culture plates using a P1000 pipette and spun down for 8 min at 500 g with the brakes off. Cell pellets were then incubated with Cell Recovery Solution (Roche Diagnostics) for 30 min on ice to remove excess BME. Cells liberated from BME were then washed three times in excess PBS to remove any residual BME. After the last wash, all PBS was removed and the tube opening was quickly dried using a paper towel. Cell pellets were snap frozen in dry ice and stored at −80 °C.
units.rationale: Details the procedure for collecting and preserving organoid material.

units.title: Organoid lysis and peptide preparation for LC‑MS/MS
units.text: Organoids were lysed by gentle vortexing in 8 M Urea in 50 mM ammonium bicarbonate supplemented with 50 µg/ml DNAse I (Sigma-Aldrich), 50 µg/ml RNAse A (Sigma-Aldrich) and 1× complete EDTA-free protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche Diagnostics). Subsequently, the lysate was cleared by centrifugation for 1 h at 18,000 g at 15 °C. Protein concentration was determined with the Bradford assay. For each sample, 20 µg of total protein was reduced, alkylated, and digested sequentially with Lys‑C (1:100) and trypsin (1:75). For high‑pH reversed‑phase fractionation, peptide digests were loaded on C18 STAGE‑tips in 200 mM ammonium formate at pH 10 and eluted into 5 fractions with 11–80% acetonitrile.
units.rationale: Provides the complete workflow for protein extraction, digestion, and peptide fractionation prior to mass spectrometry.
